moves.1. e4: Standard opening to grab some of the center
moves.1... e5: Have to counter or lose some of the center myself.
moves.2... Nc6: Counter that threat and develop at the same time.
moves.3... Nf6: And I counter with my knight to keep development even.
moves.4. Bc4: Bishoped developed which allows for 0-0 next move.
moves.4... Bc5: This move also develops my bishop and allows for 0-0 next move.
moves.6. Ng5: Not sure about this move.  But I do see a bishop and knight trade for a rook and pawn.
moves.6... h6: Lets see if I am right.
moves.7. Nxf7: And the trade off begins.  Just have to wonder if rook and pawn or knight and bishop is more important.
moves.8. Bxf7+: In with the bishop to take the rook
moves.9... Nxe4: Grab a pawn and protect the bishop at the same time.  But leaving self open for attack.
moves.10. Qf3+: As we see here.  Both my knight and bishop under attack and can only save the knight by blocking check.
moves.11... Nd4: Put heat on my queen with an eye of moving my knight to c2.  Hoping for a bad queen move here.
moves.12. Qe4: With the queen move, the pin on the f6 knight is gone.
moves.13. Nxe4: At the price of a knight.
moves.13... Nxc2: Grab a pawn and pressure the rook.
moves.14... Qh4: Put some pressure on the knight
